website_summaries.verdict: The users were satisfied with how comfortable the New Balance 813 was for extended periods of use. It ended up being the shoe of choice for those who wanted a stable platform to walk on.
pros: A majority of users found the New Balance 813 to be comfortable for all-day wear
Many owners liked the ROLLBAR post as it provided a stable heel
The sizing and fit were considered perfect by several testers
Some consumers were pleased with the style and color options of the shoe
A few long-time wearers claimed that it was durable
The lightweight nature of the footwear was appreciated by a handful of people
cons: A minority of commenters complained that the design of the trainer looked bulky

customer_reviews.title: Comfort over style.😳
customer_reviews.text: They are comfortable enough but none too attractive, like they're from the New Balance Herman Munster collection. Really shoddy product. The top seam of the leather on both shoes turned white in less than a month. Covered it with polish but white soon returns. Very unhappy. And trust me, they are way uglier than product photo lets on.
customer_reviews.author: Potter

customer_reviews.title: I’m not sure how everyone thinks this is a comfortable shoe. It feels like you’re walking on a ...
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure how everyone thinks this is a comfortable shoe. It feels like you’re walking on a brick. There is no shock absorption. You get used to it after a while. The shoe around your foot is comfortable but zero shock absorption cancels that out. The leather is cheap pleatherish material and loses its form within days. This shoe is about the same quality as a 40 dollar Walmart shoe. The only differance is the Walmart shoe will have a sole that will fall off and this shoe has a sole that feels like a brick.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin L

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like them but sole fell apart after 6 months
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Another great product from New Balance
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many pair of the New Balance 811, 812, and now the 813 shoe. They are the best shoes I have found to date. These shoes are well worth the money and are durable. I would recommend these to anyone that wants a comfortable all day shoe for people with extra wide feet. I have a tendency to "roll" my feet outward and these shoes wear great.
customer_reviews.author: Tibs 295

customer_reviews.title: My new Office Dress shoe
customer_reviews.text: Have had the New Balance Men's MW813 Brown Size 12 4E walking shoe since October--they are a suede leather and I scotchgarded them for the winter. Also have waxed them with shoe polish. Wear this shoe to the office (wear dockers, no tie) everyday--they hold up better than any Rockport, Dexter, Hushpuppy, etc. ever owned. They are SO comfortable--no one notices I am wearing 'tennis shoes'! This is a quality product. Have owned a great many New Balance models--the most expensive are not always the most durable, or give the best ride. Of all NB's owned--this is the BEST IN SHOW. Got to keep this model in production! THANKS New Balance!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Eldridge

customer_reviews.title: They do squeek, but its worth it.
customer_reviews.text: As the other reviews have stated, these do squeek more than I'd like.... The reason is there is a hard plastic "roll bar" across the sole in the heal. The soft rubber sole and the harder material flex and squeek... That being said, my feet tend to roll (pronate) when i walk, which over time aggravates my plantar fascitis causing foot pain.... Thanks to this "roll bar" technology, it limits that rolling, so my feet don't hurt anymore. I can tolerate the squeek to be out of pain. I expect maybe some silicone lubricant spray around the roll bar insert may help reduce or eliminate the squeeking, so I'll give that a try.
customer_reviews.author: MyTechGuyRI

customer_reviews.title: Could not afford 928s but these are not a bargain
customer_reviews.text: I have had two pairs of 928s (v1 and v3) and I really liked them. I travel a good deal and work on my feet. As my last pr of 928s were looking sad, I went and compared all NB walking shoes. I just did not think I could justify the higher cost. My mistake. These are clearly not as good. And, one thing is missing and that is the ventilation holes. The shoes are hot. I first thought they were not real leather, but everything says they are, but they don't breathe at least in a warmer climate. They are not as comfortable or as supportive either. I may just have to donate these and bite the 928 bullet.
customer_reviews.author: R. Michael McLellan

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in New Balance.
customer_reviews.text: I have always had confidence that New Balance makes good products until I purchased this MW813 Walking Shoe which I have since returned. First of all the leather is very stiff & is much darker than shown in the on-line pictures. The soles of the shoes are very hard, almost like a cheap plastic. Even though I ordered the 9 4E Extra Wide shoe, it was still too narrow.. I am very disappointed that New Balance would market a shoe almost as poorly made as Rockport.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: The fit is great durability is good.
customer_reviews.text: These are the fourth pair I have purchased from you. That should be telling in a positive way. The only problem I have experienced was that after a year or so of rigorous use one of the soles tended to separate. The tops stayed relatively stable. By the way, I appreciate your including the shorter laces. Saves me from having to buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick K. Hidy

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding produce
customer_reviews.text: I will never buy another brand of shoe or sneaker again. I have a 13W foot and am 275 lbs. I do a ton of walking on the job everyday. I had always had foot pain with almost every other brand. Asics were the closest to being great for me. But once I tried my first pair of NB's, I will only buy these from now on. I hope they keep the quality and comfort up. I'm also rough on these shoes wearing them 12 plus hours a day for most of the year. I will be ordering another pair of these later this year. Thank you NB for making a quality product!
customer_reviews.author: Shane C Hartman

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, but poor build quality
customer_reviews.text: Great for wide feet, even if they are pretty bland looking. Nice and roomy for adding a gel insole too. I keep buying New Balance walking shoes because they fit my feet better than anything else, but they are poorly made and don't last. Expect to get 6 months of daily use as a work shoe for someone who is in retail and on their feet 8-10 hours a day. Mine always split right where my pinky toe touches the side. Been through four pairs in two years.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: These need a warranty
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in November of 2018.it is Feb 2 2019 and they have Already started to wear out.I personally would not recommend wasting money on expensive shoes.I think a pair of shoes should last longer than 3 months
customer_reviews.author: ABeerman

customer_reviews.title: New Balance MW813 Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I've been purchasing the MW81x NB walking shoes for at least 10 years. Up to the MW812 model these were great shoes. Since then I bought 3 pairs of newer MW813 model. Each one of these self destructed after about 6 months. The soles wore through at the heels. I ended up walking on the plastic beneath. The white surface peels off like it's paint. I'm a 68 year old and I am not mistreating these shoes. I called New Balance today. They are are totally mystified. They suggested a more expensive model. No thanks.
customer_reviews.author: john konrath

customer_reviews.title: Look and fit great, but the suede will require care and careful wearing
customer_reviews.text: These are replacing a black pair that have one shoe that is too tight (got it at an outlet.) This pair fits perfectly. I do not have large feet, but they are wide just at the widest part, so New Balance "E" is about the only shoes I can wear. I was not sure what the suede would be like. It is obvious it will be susceptible to scrapes and scratches, unlike the normal leathery finish on black NB shoes. So these will now be special occasion shoes. I use the expensive New Balance insoles with the foam egg for the metatarsal area, so the default insoles get tossed out.
customer_reviews.author: Todd S. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: good shoes, reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of this model and about the 10th pair of New Balance shoes. I have wide feet (4EE) and have trouble getting shoes wide enough in popular styles. New Balance always fit and are of good quality at a reasonable price. I wear these shoes at work and find them to be comfortable however the inner lining dose not hold up really well and after awhile ( 2 + years) I did get some separation of the sole but probably not unreasonable based on how much I wear them. If not for this I would have rated them a 5 for value , fit and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: M Grima

customer_reviews.title: Good but not near as good as the MK706V2
customer_reviews.text: Shoe is comfortable but not near as good as MK706V2. Not made in the USA
customer_reviews.author: genesrus

customer_reviews.title: Great  quality, fair price .
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing NB for years and have never been disappointed This last pair I bought in December and since then have put over 1200 miles on them. Its now June 4th. I am a 200+ pound man and they have just started to split a bit on the side due to my wide feet. "EEEE" I walk all day long at my job (security) and run/walk in the morning for about an hour almost everyday. I do put Dr. Scholl's inserts in them for extra support. Can't say enough good things about these shoes, super quality and a fair price
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Only shoe I'll buy online
customer_reviews.text: I hate buying shoes online. They NEVER fit, so they are not one of the few things I'll never buy online... except New Balance. Their sizes are consistent, all of the time. They also make a great shoe and many of their shoes are made in the US. These shoes fit perfect right out of the box, which is what I've come to expect from New Balance. Very comfortable walking shoe and dressy enough to wear to work with slacks.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: They feel great! This is the most comfortable shoe I've had ...
customer_reviews.text: I saw a few glowing reports about the New Balance MW813 walking shoe, so I decided to try a pair. They feel great ! This is the most comfortable shoe I've had on my feet in a long time. Usually, I buy 11 1/2 EEE for my fat feet, but I got this one in 2E, and they're fine. Being disabled, I'm home all the time, so I needed a pair of shoes to wear around the house, to the store, doctor, etc., and this is the perfect shoe for doing just that.
customer_reviews.author: Okey D. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: One of the latest is their walking shoe which is simply great. This shoe is also good
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing New Balance Shoes for several years now. One of the latest is their walking shoe which is simply great. This shoe is also good, it was comfortable right from the very beginning and didn't require what I would call break in time wearing it for short periods. I am don't walk as much now as I use to but I do walk enough to want comfort and support. These shoes provide both for me.
customer_reviews.author: Flyboy

customer_reviews.title: A good shoe that comes in wide widths.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality as expected from New Balance. I like that their shoes come in wide sizes and that the sizes are consistent. I am a woman, but buy the men's EE shoes. I can order any style and the shoe will fit. I take out the insoles and replace them with custom orthotics and they fit just fine. I wish that in the description of the shoe it said if the style was cushion or stability or neutral. Could not find that info on the Amazon description.
customer_reviews.author: V. A. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Sad and Too small
customer_reviews.text: I could tell as soon as I pulled them out of the box that they were too small. I normally wear Men’s size 12.5 wide (4e) and my other pair of New Balance’s fit perfectly. That size wasn’t available in this pair, so I ordered a size 13 which normally fits about as well. These were too narrow and uncomfortable. I put them back in the box and immediately returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Neveils

customer_reviews.title: comfortable shoe. It is not fashionable
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid,, comfortable shoe. It is not fashionable. It is a bit clinky. it is a walking shoe that will hold up through the day. The support is solid, the fit excellent. It goes with dark clothes — corduroys perhaps. I recommend this shoe for anyone with flat and/or wide feet, slight balance problems, or even just for those who like to take long walks. —H.J. Bershady
customer_reviews.author: Harold J. Bershady

customer_reviews.title: Quality product. Bad sales pitch.
customer_reviews.text: I had to return these ,very reluctantly! Became very painful because of the tight toe box. The first time I ever had an issue with New Balance. Perhaps the lower price indicated a problem. If so, beware NB ! Your reputation for quality and great fit for those of us with wide feet has brought a large market share. Customer loyalty is not a guarantee. If the shoe doesn't fit, don't rely on deceptive marketing to clear the warehouse.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: New Balance has reduced their widths
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 6E to replace an old 4E NB that was never quite large/wide enough and this 6E was slightly narrower than my old 4E. It seems NB has reduced their widths on their shoes. This is very disappointing as I really need new shoes and NB was the last non special order company that made shoes that fit me. If you have a true 6E foot it is time to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Sarai Prochazka

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 10.5 4 E. These fit right out of the box, no break in .. only thing I would change would be the finish...I like a shinier finish..It has been very hard for me to find shoes that fit, due to my wide foot...New Balance and their other shoe Co, Dunham have made my life easier finding shoes that fit. These shoes are perfect...! Got a wide or narrow foot? Look no further!!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald

customer_reviews.title: Caveat emptor, quia ignorare non debuit quod jus alienum emit
customer_reviews.text: Great fitting 6E width shoe. Unfortunately the shoelaces are grossly undersized. Had to buy a pair over 10" longer to adequately lace the shoe. Overall very impressed with over 150 miles on them already. Arch support is moderate to low so expect to swap insoles if you need arch support. Stiching, sole wear, and durability of the leather uppers has been excellent so far. Shoe doesn't breathe very well compared to many of their other offerings but performs decently for all-leather uppers.
customer_reviews.author: Charles E. Stillman

customer_reviews.title: A comfortable shoe that works well with prescription orthotics
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoes. Fit my somewhat bulky prescription orthotics although I had to go up 1-1/2 sizes. Not particularly stylish but that's not what I bought them for. Polish occasionally and leather stays in good condition. Some sole delamination after a year or so but not a problem for me. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: BillH

customer_reviews.title: Comfort plus "style"
customer_reviews.text: My husband has the brown and finds these very comfortable. In the past I would sometimes complain about his choice of footwear when we go out somewhere casual, like the movies. He would want to wear his regular blue and grey New Balance running shoes because they are comfortable. He prefers comfort over style. This solves the problem, because now he can be comfortable wearing these when we go out, and not look like he just came from the gym!
customer_reviews.author: Faye

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and supportive
customer_reviews.text: The shoes were for my son who does alot of walking. He has been wearing New Balance shoes for quite some time & they fit well . He was very pleased with them. They shipped very quickly. A good choice for afordability & durabilty.
customer_reviews.author: Pam M.

customer_reviews.title: All day comfort, good back & knee support
customer_reviews.text: I have narrow feet, and finding shoes is very difficult. (B width). These shoes fit perfectly and are very comfortable for all-day wear. Also, I have back and knee problems, and the proper shoes are critical to back and knee comfort. These shoes are excellent. Finally, I don't need strong arch support. So they are fine for me, but I have no idea how they are for others.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R. Frazer

customer_reviews.title: A good brand, but a little small
customer_reviews.text: I really like New Balance shoes, particularly their walking and training shoes. Usually I order a size 8.5 (US) and it fits right, but for some reason this particular model is smaller; the 8.5 was way too tight for me, so I had to send it back. (The training shoe in size 8.5 that I ordered that I ordered at the same time fits just fine.) I will be trying a wider version of this walking shoe, or perhaps a size 9.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Why are shoes made with high drop and huge toe spring?
customer_reviews.text: These take the cake as the most uncomfortable shoes I have ever tried on. The heel has an inch of drop and the toe spring must be 30 degrees. This focuses your weight directly on the ball of the foot, making it go numb, even when not walking. Plus the 4E width is like a D width. I don't understand why manufacturers make these torture devices. Can anybody actually wear these pieces of junk?
customer_reviews.author: Ainsley Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe at a fine price
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying another NB hiking shoe for twice the price of this one. This shoe is nearly the equal of that shoe! I walk a lot, this shoe let’s me do that without my feet hurting at the end of the day. Good looking and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff kerr

customer_reviews.title: Beware Narrow Top
customer_reviews.text: I’m very disappointed with the comfort of this shoes. My size is 42 EU and I choose 43EU to make sure it perfectly fits. And did perfectly match my foot size. However, the top of the shoes are very narrow that you can’t even walk 50 meters. It isn’t ergonomic at all due to the narrow top part. Since it shipped outside the US now I can’t return it due to high return cost. Shortly speaking I just wasted my money. I highly recommend think twice before you buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Azer

customer_reviews.title: Hated them!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't send them back fast enough. At least 1/2 size smaller than other NB shoes. Narrower as well. Felt like an inferior footbed, actually, it was more of a footBAD! The shoes with the ABZORB footbed feel much, much better. I'll go back to the 928v3 and pay more than 2x what these cost, just to have a decent shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sigers

customer_reviews.title: Two different widths
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a XX-Wide size which says it's 6E. The left shoe was a bit snug but the right shoe was maybe a 4E or less. It was uncomfortable. I've never had a New Balance shoe of 6E be uncomfortable and I've always loved New Balance over many years and shoes. This is my first negative review for a NB hoe.
customer_reviews.author: H1H

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of space in toes
customer_reviews.text: Most shoes constantly squeeze my toes, to the point i've lost a toenail from the pressure. The extra extra large on these, plus a more roomy design in general, solved that problem. They still look enough like a dress shoe to pass my works "business casual" dresscode, while providing the comfort I need.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoes, but poor inner lining
customer_reviews.text: The heel inner lining/padding is very poor quality. I've had these shoes about a year, worn mainly in the winter, and the lining around the heel is falling apart on both shoes - exposing foam padding, which is also disintegrating. These are otherwise comfortable and a good fit for my wide feet. So now I need new shoes. Something like these ones, but with better lining.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Cullen

customer_reviews.title: Wore out quickly
customer_reviews.text: These things wore out way too quickly. Yeah, I'm tough on shoes - I buy maybe a pair a year and wear them everyday until they wear out. Been doing that for some 20 years. But these...the tops tore after only two months. Well short of what I expect out of a shoe. They are basically garbage now after 3 months. Very poor quaility shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for wide (EEEE) feet
customer_reviews.text: New Balance is one of a few shoe companies that makes wide widths. This is my 4th pair. The SL-2 last that these shoes are made on fit my feet perfectly. Sometimes it's hard to get last information for various New Balance models without inspecting them in person.. Now that I know what last fits me best, I can confidently order any model that is made on this last and know that it will fit.
customer_reviews.author: G. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: New Balance is the go-to for wide feet!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wearing these for about two weeks and I am happy with them. They are comfortable, supportive and fit is as expected for the 2E width. My feet get a bit warm because these don’t seem to breath much but that’s not a big deal. I will say that the shoelaces don’t stay tied, even if you double knot them. My NB running shoes are the same way...but that’s just a minor irritant that can be solved by replacing the laces.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon R.

customer_reviews.title: Update two years later and they are still my dad's best shoes to walk
customer_reviews.text: My dad suffers from diabetes foot and for almost a year could not walk out of pain in his knee! Took a chance buying him these and all the problems he had are gone!!! No more doctor's appointments he basically goes everywhere with these shoes! I wish they would make them also as formals shoes! Update two years later and they are still my dad's best shoes to walk, dance and everything else!
customer_reviews.author: EPCab

customer_reviews.title: Right fit with enough room for those with foot problems.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoe. Works great with and addition insert specifically designed for Morten’s Neuroma. I bought the insert needed along with a smaller insert that goes on top which targets the area that generates the pain. Works for me!
customer_reviews.author: David Sigue

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoes for people with long narrow feet!
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit great for people with narrow (size B) feet. There is plenty of room but narrow enough to keep your feet from slipping. While this is is great these shoes also have a generous toe box. This prevents your toes from getting cramped up. New Balance really understand the plight of people with long narrow feet. Other people with wide feet same the same thing. I wear these until they fall apart but I may order another pair of these and hold on to them.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen J. Freidell

customer_reviews.title: So Long NewBalance
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing New Balance shoes for years. Always good quality and were comfortable to wear. These shoes are supposed to be a 13 6E and are so narrow that I have an older pair of 13 4E New Balance shoes that are wider than the 6E's. I am very disappointed in how New Balance's fit and quality have deteriorated over the last few year. These shoes also are tight fitting in length as well. I cannot waste my time or money purchasing shoes that are not true to the size that they claim to be. I am moving on to another manufacturer. Very disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Assessment
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 4EEE as I have a pair that is really comfortable. Last longer than my prior running shoes - ASICs are really good (GT2000 model), but the top starts to deteriorate after about 4 months. I owned many pairs over 40 years. I've tried other brands including NIke, but ASIC is a very good running shoe. As I switched to walking, I've noticed that the New Balance is comfortable & lasts quite long.. The width runs small which is why I had gone to the 4EEE.
customer_reviews.author: Alton Nadamoto

customer_reviews.title: Quality product, I'm pleased
customer_reviews.text: This new balance 813mw walking shoe is comfortable and quality made. I bought the 11.5 W and the fit is excellent. I walk 45 min. to an hour+ daily. I recommend this shoe. This shoe is exactly the same as the new balance 577 (got this info directly from new balance) walking shoe except it has roll bar technology. Depending on price I may go with the 577 next time. Then I can decide if the roll bar technology makes a difference or not.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for diabetics and people needing inserts.
customer_reviews.text: My husband has Charcot's foot and needs a show with a high toe box to accommodate the special inserts he has to wear. These shoes fit perfectly for him, this is the third pair we have bought for him in black, also has a pair in white and ordered the brown ones this time around also.
customer_reviews.author: dlu

customer_reviews.title: Bad sizing
customer_reviews.text: If I could get the right size, I think these shoes would be great. Size 8 is what I’ve always gotten and they are way too small. Ordered a 9 and they are way too big. Don’t know if I will try to order again because of this issue.
customer_reviews.author: f. lastname

customer_reviews.title: No other shoe is this comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried Rockport, Nike, Reebok, and Asics wide shoes and non of those brands comes close to New Balance in terms of comfort. The only other shoe that would be better is the New Balance 706 "mail-man" shoe, but those are a bit expensive. The few downsides are the shoe's simplistic and slightly chunky design and the non-breathable leather upper. Also, odd numbered wide width user should go up in width not down.
customer_reviews.author: ISM

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I was weary to purchase these due to some bad reviews I read but they are perfect for work and really comfortable. Good value for the price as well. I wish I would have ordered two pairs as I will wear these everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelyn tunkl

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality New Balance shoes
customer_reviews.text: I previously purchased a different style of NB shoes which I returned. Decided to go back to old faithfuls - the 813 style. They are comfortable and appear well made. Glad I decided to purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Frank Vigil

customer_reviews.title: Very noisy squeak.
customer_reviews.text: Squeak is not fixable. Can only wear on country gravel road. Don't buy. Embarrassing. Can't wear at work. Tried powder. Tried shoe oil. Squeak. Wish I had returned before deadline.
customer_reviews.author: LSURugby

customer_reviews.title: really a well built and good looking shoe as u would expect from new balance love the brown color
customer_reviews.text: the only thing disappointing was that the wide size didn't give me as much room as I thought it would. I'm hoping that wearing them will stretch the width a little, but otherwise I love the shoe
customer_reviews.author: lucky man

customer_reviews.title: He's been pleased with these shoes so far
customer_reviews.text: My husband's feet supinate - which means he walks on the outside of them. He bought these after researching walking shoes to find one that would help with the problem, as lately it's caused his knees to start hurting (enough for him to go the doctor). He's been pleased with these shoes so far. And he's commented that he really likes the arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Blissful

customer_reviews.title: Still not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: I need a shoe that is really wide to accommodate damaged feet. I was hoping these would be wide enough but they are not. These shoes are probably just fine in most cases but they still are not wide enough for me. The shoe quality is fine and they are nice enough looking and come with nice insoles. They are worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Warren W. Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Mw813 vs 928
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price but not nearly as good as the 928 for comfort and support. Bought them both for my son and had him try both, We will keep the 813 for bouncing around but will not be the long days on his feet in retail.
customer_reviews.author: G Price

customer_reviews.title: Excellant Choice
customer_reviews.text: New Balance Walking Shoes are fantastic. They fit well and are very comfortable. I needed shoes that could be modified for medical reasons by my doctor and am very happy with her recommendation. Would recommend them for anyone wanting quality, comfortable foot ware for any purpose.
customer_reviews.author: John Coake

customer_reviews.title: I got a wide foot and need a 6E
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit just like my other 6E shoes... I've only worn them a handful of times, very comfortable... Will buy again, if they last... Now it's time to see how long they will last! So far they are everything I am expecting for someone with a wide foot! I wear a size 12 and do a lot of walking.
customer_reviews.author: E. Potter

customer_reviews.title: Walking shoes that can do business casual
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are extremely supportive and comfortable. I can do a nice long lunch walk on varying terrain and then walk right into a meeting and not look like I'm in tennis shoes (even though I am).
customer_reviews.author: Smarkeaux

customer_reviews.title: Good comfortable shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Just bought my second pair of these after the first pair finally started to wear out 2 years after I bought them. I wear them everyday and have hiked and traveled many places with them. They never frayed and the soles held up great, Once they are broken in you don't even think about them on your feet. Best shoes I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Mike G

customer_reviews.title: Good basic shoe
customer_reviews.text: Been using this style for a few years. Good fit and finish along with durability. Not quite as cushioned as some other styles of new balance but still a good shoe that does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Missouri Slim

customer_reviews.title: A little too tight
customer_reviews.text: I have shoe stretchers. I had to use them before wearing these new shoes. Generally, I do OK buying New Balance on line, only ever having one other pair too tight to wear.
customer_reviews.author: pwhite42

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, not very attractive.
customer_reviews.text: they are quite comfortable. do not have the 'abzorb' insole, would be more cushiony if they did. however i wore them for several hours, quite comfortable. I ordered 2E (11.5) and they fit exactly as I wanted. THe leather is very dark brown, and not shiny. the color is not ideal for me, I woul dhave preferred more shoe-like leather. but it is a sneaker anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Z

customer_reviews.title: New Balance offers some Narrow Sizes!
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the shoes that could be ordered in a narrow size. It fits as it is supposed to fit, and I just wish that more shoes were offered narrows.
customer_reviews.author: Peaches

customer_reviews.title: I liked them enough after one month that I ordered a ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had these shoes for 6 months and they may be the softest walking shoe I have owned. I liked them enough after one month that I ordered a second pair. After about two months of wear, the right shoe began irritating the top of my foot, a problem I have never had before. Ditto for the second pair of shoes. Thicker socks didn't help. I finally solved the problem by not lacing the first row of shoe eyelets (i.e., those closest to the toes). So, I still love the cushioned walk these shoes provide but find it unfortunate that I had to resort to this solution.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR WIDE FEET
customer_reviews.text: After trying a number of NB in a 4E I ordered these in a 14 6E . They are a little wide which I like so I can wear thicker socks when needed.I have a narrow heel and a extra wide foot and these still can be tied snug at the ankles.My wife says the rounded toe box make my feet look smaller than other shoes where the toe box is narrower.
customer_reviews.author: glimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Adequate.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my regular size but had to send back because they were too small. I ended up ordering a half size larger and a double E instead of E. The current pair no longer squeeze my toes but the the ball of my foot is rather loose in the shoe now. Update: I received the replacement shoe and it's now a little too large but it's better than crimped toes. I've morphed into a deformed troglodyte.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt D

customer_reviews.title: Just a solid shoe...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second (or third?) pair of this model; I wear them pretty much all day every day (unless I'm in the garden or in a suit, which is rare), and so they last roughly 2 1/2 to 3 years. Good support, good sizing, break in quickly, clean up easily, keep their look for a long time, very comfortable. I have wide feet so I've been in New Balance for almost 20 years now, only had one problem (which I painlessly exchanged).
customer_reviews.author: J. Tuttle

customer_reviews.title: There was a time NB held true
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for work for which I am a Server Administrator, only lasted 8 months, right shoe seam (stitch) started to separate just below the N. Now they are a backyard shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Wolf00062

customer_reviews.title: I like them
customer_reviews.text: Note: I noticed that the shoes were made in Indonesia. When I order from New Balance direct, they are made in the USA. The ones made in the USA look and feel much better. The others made in Indonesia are fine but feel inferior to me.
customer_reviews.author: 1greywolf

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have problems with my feet and have used New Balance shoes for about 20 years now. I usually buy the 928's but I wanted to try a slightly different style this time with the 813's. They are as comfortable as the 928;s and are about $40 less expensive. I will be buying these now. I read the reviews that you only get about 6 or 7 months of wear from these shoes. I only got about the same from the other style so that's okay with me. My podiatrists said to change them out every 6 months anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Dozier

customer_reviews.title: Sixes and with run small and narrow.
customer_reviews.text: It,s difficult to choose any shoes on line with the hope for a good fit. I have owned a si ilar pair of New Balance and these were not even close to fitting correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Vahey

customer_reviews.title: Not good for long walks as disclosed
customer_reviews.text: At first these shoes seemed ok, but the more I use the harder they are on my feet and legs. Only used 3 or 4 times and not that supportive. They are kind of rugged not for long term walking as declared
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leather failing after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Loved the fit of the shoe but disappointed that after only 2 months of wearing them the one shoe has several spots on top where the leather is going bad. I have had this same shoe in the past and never had this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: What I expected
customer_reviews.text: I've officially worn them for 3 days out of work and 2 days for work. And so far my feet still are a bit sore, but surely not as sore as they were before. And I am on my feet for 9 plus hours and 5 plus days a week. So hopefully they keep being nice to my feet. With the size, I accidentally got a half size too big, but it's not a big deal. Just a bit roomy. Nice wide feet too, and I got the x-wide, they could sorta be a little wider. But they're comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: New Balance XXXXtra Wide shoes
customer_reviews.text: I got to have shoes with an xxxtra wide toe box due to a disability with my feet. My feet are also naturally wide. I have found that New Balance has the shoes that fit my feet and still be affordable. I have purchased New Balance shoes many times over the years. This pair is no exception, they fit my feet beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: ElectronicsGuy

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied 😊
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit. I reorder these from last year. I wish I could find women’s shoes that worked so well for me. Comfort and perfect support with my orthotics. I can stand longer and walk further than any other shoes I own.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Layton

customer_reviews.title: After a little breaking in they really feel great
customer_reviews.text: They were a little stiffer than most new pair of shoes. Took a while to break in, but that's a sign of a durable shoe. Once they loosened my feet feel great after long walks.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo G

customer_reviews.title: Only sneaker brands that carry 4e which fit me well!
customer_reviews.text: The only sneaker that ever fits me perfectly! I wear an 11 4e. There are not many sneakers that are 4e that fit me as comfortable as these!
customer_reviews.author: Matou

customer_reviews.title: Very particular about how feet should fit into them.
customer_reviews.text: Even though the shoe matched my usual measurements, it felt very stiff with little room for error regarding the shape of my foot. Can't tell you how many times I got blisters around my big toes. At some point, I had to resort to using Dr. Sholls Custom Othopedics. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing the New Balance 812 shoes for years. They were replaced by the 813 with a slightly wider toe box. I have a wide foot so these are extremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: FarmerArt

customer_reviews.title: Not solid enough for me
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are not what I expected. They fit OK. The problem for me is that they don't have a solid base. I found the New Balance 928v3 Walking Shoe to be far superior and I've been wearing them. I donated the MW813s to charity.
customer_reviews.author: Ragman

customer_reviews.title: Too big but..
customer_reviews.text: It was my fault to begin with but i ordered the wrong width but they were still extremely comfortable so i got a pair in the right size and they have been working wonders. I rated 5 stars because it was so easy to return, even late night when i get off work at 4am. I went down to a 711 near me with a drop box, 7 or so days later the money was in my account. Very happy i ordered through amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: so far the second pair is holding up better than the first
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair, I almost didn't buy this brand again because the first pair, the soles seemed to wear very quickly, so far the second pair is holding up better than the first. I only went with this brand the second time, because they fit the first time I bought them, really hate to send stuff back, so I stick with what I know.
customer_reviews.author: Frank M Roman

customer_reviews.title: Good, but does not have Cross-Trainer type support
customer_reviews.text: Nice casual shoe. Better than my Rockports as a walking shoe, but not as good as my old New Balance Cross-Trainers for support. I want support for walking, so won't get this one again for a real walking shoe.
customer_reviews.author: George H

customer_reviews.title: Ran Smaller than his other New Balance
customer_reviews.text: New balance are my husband's preferred running/walking shoes so we thought he would try these brown ones to replace his Nunn Bush casual oxfords. Sadly, he was disappointed in the fit of these. They definitely ran smaller than any of the other New Balance he has owned and had to return them. They did not have a larger size in stock for him to try.
customer_reviews.author: Allison G.

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big New Balance fan - they fit me, they're wide enough for my bunion-cursed feet. Good support, comfortable. Find 'em on sale and you can't complain about much.
customer_reviews.author: High Plains Grifter

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and feels great!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes do not look like regular walking/sport shoes. They are nice leather, all brown shoes that can be worn in an office setting, out to dinner, or for everyday comfort. Well made and look great!
customer_reviews.author: Vicky Aldrich

customer_reviews.title: Still narrow even though 4E.
customer_reviews.text: The 4 E was still quite narrow. Purchased for my Dad and he liked them even though a little narrow. He is hoping the will stretch a bit. No imperfections on the shoes but the show box was badly damaged. Hated giving them as a gift in a box in such bad shape. Shipping box was fine. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Bobsgirl

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have worn New Balance shoes for years. This model is for supination. They are the only ones that are comfortable for me. I always buy these and nothing else.
customer_reviews.author: Connie S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice generic shoes
customer_reviews.text: I want plain shoes that fit, fit, fit! These are the shoes for me. They deliver the goods! But, the laces do not stay tight like I would expect, but I can double knot them into submission... a small correction.
customer_reviews.author: B. Green

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but, maybe New Balance changed their mold.
customer_reviews.text: I'll have to have them stretched a little. New Balance must've changed their mold. This pair and the last pair I bought a few months back fit narrow across the toes, so, need stretching. Stretching does work to a minimal extent. The stitching of the shoes makes them hard to stretch perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Oregonian101

customer_reviews.title: Tight and Stiff. In this case, not a good combination.
customer_reviews.text: The shoe was too small and stiff. I settled and regretted the mistake. Fortunately I hadn't worn the shoes outside the house, and returned them without hassle. I then spent the extra dough for a pair of 928s which fit grood and feel great.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Bad sneakers, stay away
customer_reviews.text: Most uncomfortable pair of sneakers I’ve ever worn. No support at all. Even inserts didn’t help.
customer_reviews.author: El presidente

customer_reviews.title: Not Good
customer_reviews.text: After wearing these for 3 days I couldn't walk. There is no arch support and very little cushioning. I like the crossbar and the stride path but really?
customer_reviews.author: A.W.

customer_reviews.title: Third time buying
customer_reviews.text: This is the third time I have bought these. I have wide and fat feet and these fit me well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, but a bit hard on the feet.
customer_reviews.text: Good fit and came delivered in a plain box, which I like. The fit is good, however, the soles lack good cushion. I will have to buy some custom insoles to make up for the poor cushioning, my feet were sore after about one hour of standing/walking. These are bright white, they arrived in new condition.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J. Mcmahon

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe, weird laces
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe overall. I usually wear a more athletic New Balance but I decided to try this one out and it's a pretty good shoe, quite comfortable and sturdy. Only real criticism is the laces - the ones it comes with are sort of flat and do not stay tied well. I recommend replacing them if you don't want your shoes to come untied frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

product_meta.title: New Balance Men's Mw813 Walking Shoe
product_meta.description: A Motion Control Health Walker featuring lightweight PU midsole and our tried and true Roll Bar Technology
